intro: Radiogrammitis kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu moss, is a rare and specialized fern found in the high-altitude regions of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its mountainous habitat. The plant thrives in shaded, rocky crevices and is closely associated with the unique microclimates of the rainforest canopy. Its reproductive structures are typically hidden within the dense foliage, making it challenging to observe in its natural environment. Due to its restricted distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, Radiogrammitis kinabaluensis is considered a valuable indicator species for the ecological health of its habitat.
